Description: Unique numerical identifier for each record in the SITES table.

Unique site identifier, descriptive enough to differentiate from other sites and sufficient to identify the site within the original publication. When an offficial/conventional name exists for a site, this should be used. Links to SITES, PLOTS, HISTORY, and MEASUREMENTS tables.
Alternative site names or commonly used abbreviations
Name of research site containing >1 distinct sites associated with multiple original studies. At least two of the sites within a super.site are nested, overlapping, or of unknown relationship.
Research network(s) in which the site is included, if applicable.
Nearest city, when identified in original publication.
State / province/ region
Country
Latitude, where negative values indicate S hemisphere
Longitude, where negative values indicate W hemisphere
Elevation in meters above sea level. When a range is given, midpoint is reported.
Notes pertaining to site name, location, or topography
Mean annual temperature
Mean temperature of the coldest month
Mean temperature of the warmest month
Mean annual precipitation
Climate details not included above
Soil texture, based on % sand-silt-clay. Reported as catergorical classiffication, which follows USDA classification when derived based on % sand-silt-clay reported in original study.
Soil percent sand. If multiple depths are given, this is the top layer. If multiple values are reported for a site, this is the average.
Soil percent silt. If multiple depths are given, this is the top layer. If multiple values are reported for a site, this is the average.
Soil percent clay. If multiple depths are given, this is the top layer. If multiple values are reported for a site, this is the average.
Soil classification (USDA soil taxonomy or FAO soil classification)
Soil details not included above
Notes on sites hydrology (e.g., terra firma, seasonally flooded)
Site details not included above

Groups geographically proximate sites, where proximity was defined using a hierarchical cluster analysis on the distance matrix of the sites and a cutoff of 25km (R script available in the Github scripts folder).
Biogeographical region, extracted from map of (Olson et al. 2001)
Koppen-Geiger classification, extracted from the ESRI Koppen-Geiger map (http://www.arcgis.com/home/item.html?id=7a53584fa55643df969f93cec83788e1).
Variable.Codes: Given in Table 1 of Peel et al. (2007)

Description: FAO global ecological zones classification, extracted from FAO's GeoNetwork (http://www.fao.org:80/geonetwork).
Original site.ID, where numbers <=503 correspond to records released in the first published version of the database (Anderson-Teixeira et al., 2016)
Citation ID(s) of reference(s) reporting measurements at this site.

Citation ID(s) of reference from which site data were obtained. "NA" indicates that all site data were obtained from references associated with measurement data. Citation.ID is in the form [last name of first author]_[year]_[first letter of first four words of title] and links to citation.ID in the citations table.
Notes on references for site data, including citations of publications not included in the ForC references library.

Indicates studies that were flagged because they lack information obtained directly from the original study. A missing value code ('NA') does not necessarily guarantee that information was obtained from an original publication.

Citation ID(s) of data compilations from which data were obtained, if applicable. Citation.ID is in the form [last name of first author]_[year]_[first letter of first four words of title] and links to citation.ID in the citations table.
Name of individual who created the record

temporary working field grouping sites that are potentially duplicates. 0 indicates that sites are unique; numbers indicate groups of sites that are geographically proximate (within 5km) and have measurement values reported by more than one study.
temporary working field for sites that are potentially duplicates. Within each group of potential duplicates, this field identifies sub-groups.
temporary working field for sites that are potentially duplicates.
Variable.Codes: 1- site records have been reviewed and confirmed to be unique; 0- preliminary review indicates likely duplication that needs to be resolved; NA-no potential duplicates identified by automated script; NAC- not yet reviewed

Description: potential duplicates for site. For example, if Sites 1,2,3,4 are all unique, but Site 5 might be a duplicate of one of those [eg a flux tower in a site], then the entries for Sites 1,2,3,4 would each be "5", whereas the entry for Site 5 would be "1,2,3,4"
temporary working field with notes regarding sites that are potentially duplicates.
